title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are predicted to be active in free agency, with potential signings including Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso.
Insiders suggest the Red Sox are favorites to re-sign Alex Bregman, with contract projections around six years and up to $171 million.
Pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez are among the top pitcher targets for the Red Sox, with Valdez listed as a good fit.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway in Boston on November 7, 2025.
The concert featured songs from his debut album 'Get Lifted' and several covers, showcasing his musical versatility.
Legend's setlist included hits like 'All Of Me' and 'Tonight (Best You Ever Had)', alongside covers of various artists.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic on Friday.
Brown previously criticized officials for a missed foul in the Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Jazz.
Despite critical remarks, Brown was not fined as the league acknowledged a missed call in the Jazz game.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Buccaneers hold a 6-2 record, with losses against the Eagles and Lions, strong NFC contenders.
Quarterback Baker Mayfield has a 98.1 passer rating, with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and two interceptions.
Rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards, but wide receivers Chris Godwin and Mike Evans are injured.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, their first Patriots game in over two years.
The game's significance reflects the Patriots' resurgence under quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.
Nantz and Romo were initially scheduled for Bills-Dolphins but shifted due to Miami's poor season performance.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, but the Celtics lost to the Magic 123-110 in the NBA Cup match.
Magic outperformed Celtics with 17 three-pointers at 47.2% shooting, highlighting Boston's struggle from the arc.
Celtics' backup centers underperformed; Luka Garza's -16 impact emphasized team's defensive issues.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating an 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 ICE case.
A Massachusetts hearing officer found Joseph did not authorize the ICE evasion but recommended a public reprimand due to perceived bias.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after she referred herself to a state misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Boston Red Sox were eliminated by the New York Yankees in the American League Wild Card Series.
Manager Alex Cora expressed optimism about the future, noting the team gained valuable postseason experience.
Offseason decisions loom for the Red Sox, with key players opting in or out of contracts and potential trades ahead.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75 to 100-foot blade detached from a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth, Massachusetts, falling into a cranberry bog.
The incident occurred near 810 Head of the Bay Road, a remote location with no reported injuries or public danger.
The turbine entered fail-safe mode and shut down automatically; the area was secured and the investigation is ongoing.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' streams on Disney+, featuring Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby as Marvel's iconic superheroes.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro, streaming on Netflix, offers a unique take on Mary Shelley's classic novel.
'Materialists,' a romcom starring Dakota Johnson and Chris Evans, is available for streaming on HBO Max.
